column5: Greetings,  Please see below:  Meant to post this in September. oops  This is my niece with her first pike. I took her on a multi-dockside fishing trip to reconnect (hadn't seen her for awhile) SHE WAS SOOOOO EXCITED! It was a great day. She still brings it up every time we talk now. She is a natural at fishing. She landed and released the pike with minimal help from me. A crowd quickly assembled on the dock while she worked it.  Watch the video, the pike freaks and wacks my camera within mm of the water!  VIDEO:  Total crowd pleaser. There's even more people back there. The other kids there thought she was a goddess for catching a pike!  Here is a small bass caught after dinner  aaaaaaand the release  She's caught some lunker bass since the age of 3!  Here's a mini pike. No she's not smokin' it's a sucker. love the glasses! She thought they were magic water glasses!    Filler,  Poor pic of musky skull but you can see why they hurt other critters    buh bye  S.

Priceless...just priceless Grant.  She handled that fish like a pro!  She had a good coach as well.  Looks like your camera got slimed too...LOL.  Ok...fess up now....you started catching more pike AFTER fishing with her....I think we know who taught who in the art of pike fishing....
After looking at her pics and the video, I concur... she is a goddess!  Absolute sweetie! You must be very proud! HH
Yes, yes, I admit it; She's taught me everything I know.   She was the first grandchild in the family. She is extremely smart and mature. Her behaviour is exemplary. I am proud
Now thats what fishing is really all about.  Great stuff and thanks for sharing even if it's a few months late .
Good On ya for getting another kid hooked on the sport we all enjoy so much... looks like ya have a new fishing buddy now eh
that's awesome! i still remember my first pike. i was shakin at the knees for over an hour afterwards.  looks like you almost lost the camera when that thing started floppin around.
Love those pics snag.My son just caught his first Pike this winter .Thanks we needed that with the odd ice report coming in.
That is absolutely awesome! She is a fishing goddess, so cool & calm! I really miss fishing with my niece as she lives in Ottawa but that definitely brings back memories! Cheers, Dave
I agree with you Cliff.  My first thought as well with a nice job of handling the fish. Cool vid Snag ... thanks for posting.
some great pics, thanks for sharing.
Kids having fun fishing is a great post, even if it's a few months late. Congrats to your niece, looks like you've got a good fishing buddy there...  Mike

She's really cute. She was very cool in the video, almost nonchalant. I think the glasses suit her  . Nice job uncle Snag! Maybe she'll follow in your footsteps. Next you can teach her to dump her bike and cell phone in the water   . Sorry, had to throw that in there   .
Cool video Grant.  Thanks.  Did you keep the musky skeleton?  Joey

Thanks everyone.  Posts with kids rule because the kids tend to have an unconditional joy for fishing. It rekindles my memories of excitement.     Yeah, I know I have a few more lessons in me!    No, It was to big!
wow that was awesome!  And to have it on video is amazing!  Cheers!
